name: photovoltaic module production, building-integrated, for facade installation | photovoltaic module, building-integrated, for facade installation | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8311/documentation

This dataset represents the production of the structural components necessary for the integration of 1 m2 photovoltaic laminate at a building's façade. ;;The integration of solar laminates in a façade is mainly useful for new buildings or as a part of renovation activities. It is more frequently used for industrial buildings. Conventional façade elements can be replaced by solar panels. 

From delivery of the needed materials and parts. 

This activity ends with the installed mounting structure. 

This dataset includes
 - Energy use for the metal processing. 

This dataset doesn't include the energy use for the mounting process itself. This must be included in data for the PV-plant, where all necessary components (panel/laminate, mounting structure, inverter etc.) are assembled and mounted on the building.
It also doesn't include packaging materials.
category: F:Construction/43:Specialized construction activities/439:Other specialized construction activities/4390:Other specialized construction activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The calculation of the annual production volume of the reference product is based on data from 2008. It does not represent an average of the time period 1992-2008.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This type of mounting system is described by only one possible example. A market survey for mounting systems has been published by Siemer (2003; 2006; 2007; 2008). In this survey the total weight of several dozen of different mounting systems is reported without providing more detailed information on the type of materials used. In order to achieve an average weight for this type of mounting system, the weights of the different mounting system models were weighted by their installed capacity in Europe.


The different types of mounting systems were described in a handbook for tilers <Prinz et al. 1992>. The examples for slanted roof and façade plants have been investigated for singlecrystalline cells. The average consumption of packaging material for the finished PV plants is calculated with a correction factor from this old information, which accounts for the average weight of 1992-2008 installations (for further information see p.91 and p.127 in Jungbluth et al. 2012)

This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
The calculation of the annual production volume of the reference product is based on data from 2008.

Sources: 
 - Siemer J. (2003) Für jedes Dach den passenden Deckel. In: Photon, Vol. 2003, retrieved from: www.photon.de
 - Siemer J. (2006) Arbeit an der Schnittstelle. In: Photon, Vol. 2006, retrieved from: www.photon.de. 
 - Siemer J. (2007) Konkurrenz belebt das Geschäft. In: Photon, Vol. 2007, re-trieved from: www.photon.de. 
 - Siemer J. (2008) Debütantenball - Marktübersicht Montagesysteme 2008. In: Photon, Vol. 2008, retrieved from: www.photon.de. 
 - H. Prinz, M. Real, W. Müller et al. „Photovoltaics für Dachdecker - Grundlagen, Systemübersicht and Ausführung“, (Vernehmlassungsausgabe 20. 11.1992), Bundesamt für Konjunkturfragen, (BfK) Programm „PACER“
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Detailed analysis of materials for one product in a diploma thesis.
